intro: Arrhostoxylum haenkeanum, commonly known as the Chilean firebush, is a shrub native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and clusters of small, bright red flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to local biodiversity.
